intro: Croton ambanivoulensis, commonly known as the Ambanivoulé croton, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that attract pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
